title: Network CLI param wrongly claims to be case insensitive
body:
<!-- Have you done the following? -->
<!--   * read the Code of Conduct? By filing an Issue, you are expected to -->  
<!--     comply with it, including treating everyone with respect: -->
<!--     https://github.com/hyperledger/besu/blob/main/CODE_OF_CONDUCT.md -->
<!--   * Reproduced the issue in the latest version of the software -->
<!--   * Read the debugging docs: https://besu.hyperledger.org/en/stable/HowTo/Monitor/Logging/ -->
<!--   * Duplicate Issue check:  https://github.com/search?q=+is%3Aissue+repo%3Ahyperledger/Besu -->
<!-- Note:  Not all sections will apply to all issue types. -->

### Description
Tried to startup a miner on Goerli by specifying `--network=goerli` and received an incorrect error message claiming the option is case insensitive:

```Invalid value for option '--network': expected one of [MAINNET, RINKEBY, ROPSTEN, GOERLI, CALAVERAS, DEV, CLASSIC, KOTTI, MORDOR, ECIP1049_DEV, ASTOR] (case-insensitive) but was 'goerli,'```

### Acceptance Criteria
* networks can be specified in any case

### Steps to Reproduce (Bug)
1. start besu with `--network=goerli`  or even `--network=GOERLI`
2. observe failure and error message

**Expected behavior:** [What you expect to happen]
successful startup

**Actual behavior:** [What actually happens]
failure to startup, and contradictory error message

**Frequency:** [What percentage of the time does it occur?]
always

### Versions (Add all that apply)
* Software version: [`besu --version`] 21.7.3-SNAPSHOT
